titleInfo.title: Mary Harris Auditorium at the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society

physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 3 x 5 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: Handwritten on envelope: ''#453 JCRS Buildings, #453 JCRS Physical Plant''. On back of photograph: ''#453 JCRS Mary Harris Auditorium''.

mods.abstract: Drawing of the Mary Harris Auditorium, as a proposed building, on the campus of the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS). The JCRS was a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients that was founded in 1904 by a group of immigrant Jewish workingmen along with the support of several leading physicians and rabbis in Denver, Colorado. The sanatorium was located on West Colfax Avenue just outside of Denver. The auditorium was built in 1941 and is still being used today as part of the Rocky Mountain College of Art and Design.
mods.note: Accession # 1271, Donated by AMC Cancer Research Center as part of the JCRS Records.
